body pattern casting on cast on using a single size 1 needle cast on 79 87 95 103 111 119 stitches using the italian cast-on note only cast on the stitches do not work additional row meant to create a tubular cast-on set-up row turn the work around using a size 0 needle *p1 k1 tbl* repeat from * to * p1 body join the work in the round using the smaller needles note 2 you will have two purl stitches next to each other at the beginning of the round note 3 you can knit the entire hat using the magic loop or you can use circular needles with a bor marker switching to dpns once the decreases require round 1 *p1-b k1* repeat from * to * p1-b round 2 *p1 k1-b* repeat from * to * p1 repeat rounds 1 & 2 until the body of the hat measures 13 cm 14 cm 15 cm 16 cm 17 cm 18 cm note 4 if you want the hat to cuff below the ears rather than above continue the above rounds for an additional 5 cm give or take decreases set-up round on a round of p1-b place stitch markers as indicated for size place markers before number of stitches between size stitch number markers* infant 9 29 49 69 20 child 11 33 55 77 22 small 11 35 59 83 24 medium 13 39 65 91 26 large 13 41 69 97 28 extra-large 15 45 75 105 30 *excluding the number of stitches between the markers that cross the beginning of the round this gap will have one stitch fewer round 1 on round of k1-b *p1 k1-b* repeat from * to * to three stitches before marker ssk the next two stitches slip the next knit stitch and stitch below purlwise over to the right needle now slip both the knit-stitch-and-stitch-below combo and the ssk back to the left needle use your right needle to slip the knit-stitch-and-stitch-below combo over the ssk stitch finally slip this double decrease stitch from the left needle purlwise to the right needle pass marker p1 with the yarn in back slip the next stitch and stitch below knitwise onto the right needle k2tog the next two stitches slip the knit-stitch-and-stitch-below combo over the new k2tog stitch repeat sequence for each marker on the round four paired sets of double decreases results in sixteen stitches decreased round 2 *p1-b k1* repeat from * to * p1-b round 3 *p1 k1-b* repeat from * to *
